_header: Jesu for Thy blood Thy bleddest
Note: Stanzas 1-7 are incorporated into 491 (stanzas 4-10); for a similar prayer see 2836.
Subjects: Christ, wounds of; prayers, by Christ and His Passion
_description: A prayer by the Seven Times Christ shed His Blood — eight 6-line stanzas

OxfBal316A.First Lines:
Ihesu for thi blode þou bleddestAnd in the firste tyme þu
                    sheddestIn thy membre pryveClense me oute of
                    lecherye…
OxfBal316A.Last Lines:
…Of al my synnes pardonAnd bryng vs to hevene
                    aboue
OxfBal316A.Note:
Added by original scribe to last folio of volume, to fill out
                    quire.
OxfBal316A.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 95-7.

OxfChrCh151.First Lines:
Ihesu for thi blode þou bleddestAnd in the furst tym þou
                    scheddist…
OxfChrCh151.Last Lines:
…Of all my synnes pardounAnd bryng vs to heuene
                    aboue
OxfChrCh151.folio: second item in the manuscript (MS has no foliation)

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Ihesu for þy bod þat þu bleddestIn þe fyrst
                    tyme þat þu sheddestIn þy membyr pryue…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Out of Enuye clanse þu meAnd graunt me to lyue in
                    charyteLord for þy wondes smerte
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
A prayer or bywar (f. 1, inserted interlineally in sixteenth-century list
                    of contents)
